meanings.definition: Relating to inhalation or the act of breathing in.
meanings.sent1: The inspiratory process helps bring oxygen into the body.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the inspiratory phase of breathing to the patient.
meanings.sent3: The inspiratory exercise class made everyone feel refreshed and energized.
meanings.sent4: Her inspiratory artwork took everyone's breath away with its beauty.
meanings.sent5: The inspiratory breeze filled the room with a sense of renewal and vitality.

meanings.definition: Serving to inspire or stimulate creativity or motivation.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's inspiratory words encouraged the students to pursue their dreams.
meanings.sent2: The movie had an inspiratory message about never giving up on your goals.
meanings.sent3: The inspiratory story about a young inventor inspired many to think outside the box.
meanings.sent4: His inspiratory leadership style motivated the team to achieve great success.
meanings.sent5: The inspiratory music filled her heart with passion and determination.
